title: fabber
description: Fabber is a tool for model-based Bayesian analysis of time-series data

data_file.title: Data File
data_file.description: Specify a single input data file

data_files.title: Multiple Data Files
data_files.description: Specify multiple data files for n=1, 2, 3...

data_order.title: Data Order
data_order.description: If multiple data files are specified, how they will be handled

mask_file.title: Mask File
mask_file.description: Mask file. Inference will only be performed where mask value > 0

mt_n.title: Masked Time Points
mt_n.description: List of masked time points, indexed from 1. These will be ignored in the parameter updates

supp_data.title: Supplemental Data
supp_data.description: 'Supplemental' timeseries data, required for some models

evaluate_output.title: Model Evaluation
evaluate_output.description: Evaluate model. Set to name of output required or blank for default output. Requires model configuration options, --evaluate-params and --evaluate-nt

evaluate_params.title: Evaluation Parameters
evaluate_params.description: List of parameter values for evaluation

evaluate_nt.title: Number of Time Points
evaluate_nt.description: Number of time points for evaluation

simple_output.title: Simple Output
simple_output.description: Instead of usual standard output, simply output series of lines each giving progress as percentage

overwrite.title: Overwrite Flag
overwrite.description: If set will overwrite existing output. If not set, new output directories will be created by appending '+' to the directory name

link_to_latest.title: Link to Latest Flag
link_to_latest.description: Try to create a link to the most recent output directory with the prefix _latest

load_models.title: Load Models
load_models.description: Load models dynamically from the specified filename, which should be a DLL/shared library

debug.title: Debug Flag
debug.description: Output large amounts of debug information. ONLY USE WITH VERY SMALL NUMBERS OF VOXELS

optfile_short.title: Options File
optfile_short.description: Read options in option=value form from the specified file

optfile_long.title: Options File
optfile_long.description: File containing additional options, one per line, in the same form as specified on the command line

anyOf.description: File containing additional options, one per line, in the same form as specified on the command line

optfile.description: File containing additional options, one per line, in the same form as specified on the command line

save_model_fit.title: Save Model Fit Flag
save_model_fit.description: Output the model prediction as a 4d volume

save_residuals.title: Save Residuals Flag
save_residuals.description: Output the residuals (difference between the data and the model prediction)

save_model_extras.title: Save Model Extras Flag
save_model_extras.description: Output any additional model-specific timeseries data

save_noise_mean.title: Save Noise Means Flag
save_noise_mean.description: Output the noise means. The noise distribution inferred is the precision of a Gaussian noise source

save_free_energy.title: Save Free Energy Flag
save_free_energy.description: Output the free energy, if calculated

help.title: Help Flag
help.description: Print this usage method. If given with --method or --model, display relevant method/model usage information

list_params.title: List Parameters Flag
list_params.description: List model parameters (requires model configuration options to be given)

desc_params.title: Describe Parameters Flag
desc_params.description: Describe model parameters (name, description, units) - requires model configuration options to be given. Note that not all models provide parameter descriptions

list_outputs.title: List Outputs Flag
list_outputs.description: List additional model outputs (requires model configuration options to be given)

old_optfile.title: Old Options File
old_optfile.description: Read options in command line form from the specified file (DEPRECATED)
